categories.name: Business Strategy
categories.description: Articles about business models, market analysis, and industry trends

categories.name: Cloud Infrastructure
categories.description: Articles about cloud computing, infrastructure design, and platform services

categories.name: Network Architecture
categories.description: Articles about network design, scalability, and infrastructure

categories.name: Network Security
categories.description: Articles about network security, zero trust, and cybersecurity best practices

categories.name: Open Source
categories.description: Articles about open source software, licensing, and community building

categories.name: Under the Hood
categories.description: Go behind the scenes of how we build. This is where we share the technical and creative decisions that drive our product forward.

authors.name: Brett Mertens
authors.bio: I've spent the majority of my career working on CDNs and DNS platforms. As a result, I'm particularly passionate about making systems that don't make the news!
authors.title: Product Lead
authors.tick: Decreasing time to dopamine for developers.
authors.surprising: I'm an artist who owns a bar / coffee shop.
authors.weekends: Walking the dog and hanging at the coffee shop.

authors.name: Brian Toresdahl
authors.bio: I earned my stripes at AWS and Outreach making internet-scale systems useful for developers and businesses before building a DNS automation startup (Cloud Valid) from zero to acquisition.
authors.title: Product Manager
authors.tick: Transforming complex internet infrastructure into simple tools for regular people.
authors.surprising: I grew up in Colorado and lived in a log cabin, where I chopped wood in winter to stay warm.
authors.weekends: Spending time with family, streaming obscure sci-fi, and paddle boarding Florida’s freshwater springs.

authors.name: Chris Berridge
authors.bio: Design leader with 20+ years shaping how people engage with digital products. From award-winning work to introducing elegant designs, nothing beats turning ideas into something people can't live without.
authors.title: Founding Designer
authors.tick: Finding that magic moment between form, function and fun.
authors.surprising: During my amateur football (soccer) career, I set the Bristol league record for yellow cards, a record I still hold. Some call it a lack of discipline, I call it consistency.
authors.weekends: Tinkering with my ancient campervan or hacking my way around Somerset's golf courses.

authors.name: Dodik Gaghan
authors.bio: From web development to shipping features that scale, I've run the user interface gamut, and am obsessed with making things just work–and look good while I'm at it!
authors.title: Engineer
authors.tick: Supercharging app performance, because we all need speed!
authors.surprising: My favorite debugging strategy? Talking to my rubber duck until it gives up first.
authors.weekends: Usually on the badminton court catching up with friends or relaxing with some team-based online games to recharge.

authors.name: Drew Raines
authors.bio: Network-obsessed since I got Internet access through a Unix shell account in the early 1990's, I've chased problems of all shapes and sizes as system administration shifted to cloud computing to SaaS-everything. Equally happy in large-scale email and DNS as I am information retrieval and distributed systems.
authors.title: Head of Engineering
authors.tick: Building companies and inspiring high-performance engineering teams.
authors.surprising: My first startup was a church.
authors.weekends: Riding my bicycle or following my wife around the garden attempting to be useful.

authors.name: Edo Aria
authors.bio: Backend developer who loves to work behind the scenes. I love helping our websites, docs, and related properties shine so that customers have a delightful experience.
authors.title: Web Developer
authors.tick: Building the infrastructure that makes the front end shine.
authors.surprising: I've made several game titles for USSD(*#)... and this was before Android OS even existed ;)
authors.weekends: Enjoying the great outdoors, camping or fishing–sometimes both!

authors.name: Evan Vetere
authors.bio: An old hacker from the 90s. I started my career in video production before bailing to systems administration and network engineering to get more sunlight. I've built infrastructure over decades with the same general approach: help developers ship faster and safer.
authors.title: Infrastructure Lead
authors.tick: Automating away problems so that people forget they ever existed.
authors.surprising: I'm currently a certified drone operator in the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada but am working on a commercial pilot's license (mostly so I can stop saying no when my neighbors ask me to do their roof inspections).
authors.weekends: Playing host to friends in my little backyard in Brooklyn. Reviews are generally mixed, but vibes are high.

authors.name: Felix Widjaja
authors.bio: I live in between technical teams and business needs, translating company direction into developer requirements. I'm known as a serious Q/A nerd.
authors.title: Web & Support
authors.tick: Give me a good time crunch and a tight deadline–I'll never miss.
authors.surprising: I have one espresso machine and three coffee grinders. I used to have a lever machine too, but the maintenance of having two was too much for me.
authors.weekends: My weekends begin with dirt or dust (gardening or house maintenance), followed by my main event: full-time dad mode.

authors.name: Jacob Smith
authors.bio: Classical musician turned developer champion and brand builder. Finding market gaps and unique ways to stand apart from the crowd is what I live for.
authors.title: Co-Founder, Head of Growth
authors.tick: Building relationships and bringing out the best in people.
authors.surprising: After Equinix, I joined my contractor's crew to build my own house.
authors.weekends: Walking the VT woods with my dogs or pitching in at the homeless shelter.

authors.name: Jose Szychowski
authors.bio: Building bridges between application development and cloud-native infrastructure is what I do best. I'm now focused on developing Kubernetes operators to build reliable and scalable systems.
authors.title: Backend Engineer
authors.tick: Working through technical problems to deliver something to users.
authors.surprising: I love fast motorcycles.
authors.weekends: Taking the boat out for a day on the water with friends.

authors.name: Kaley Gelineau
authors.bio: Creative ad agency gal turned tech marketer, community builder and customer champion. I love blending creative storytelling with technical credibility.
authors.title: GTM Lead
authors.tick: Bold ideas, color coded anything, and having my hand in lots of honeypots.
authors.surprising: I love coffee so much that I became a certified barista when I lived in Australia. Flat whites anyone?
authors.weekends: Out hiking with my four legged fluff monster, Olive, or self-learning to remodel some area of my house.

authors.name: Manish Singh
authors.bio: Builder of Secure networking, cloud services and infrastructure products for the last 25+ years at Zscaler, Netscaler, Redback networks. My current mission: building interconnects with native zero-trust everyday!
authors.title: Ecosystem Lead
authors.tick: Connecting applications, agents, services and clouds automagically with scalable, secure and programmable solutions.
authors.surprising: Giving up my age here but I did work on Dial-up ISP equipment(Ascend) and ATM(Asynchronous transfer mode) networking.
authors.weekends: Hanging out with my kids, Playing tennis or Soccer - what the rest of the world calls Football!

authors.name: Matt Jenkinson
authors.bio: A full-stack developer based in Bristol, UK I love building things that just feel right. I care about clean interfaces, predictable systems, and those little details that make a web app feel effortless.
authors.title: Frontend Engineer
authors.tick: Reliable products, the kind that work so beautifully behind the scenes, the end-user doesn't have to think twice.
authors.surprising: I spent my late teens to early twenties cutting my teeth in the music industry and made it out as far as Indonesia with my band at the time!
authors.weekends: I'm usually at a gig or watching my favourite football team Aston Villa, up the Villans!

authors.name: Ollie Miller
authors.bio: Experienced design leader shaping elegant digital products for world-class organizations. From research-led strategy to delivery, I turn complex problems into experiences that feel simple, useful, and delightful.
authors.title: Designer
authors.tick: That sweet spot where clarity, craft, and real human needs meet - and knowing when design should quietly step aside.
authors.surprising: I’ve played in bands on and off since the age of 10. The pinnacle of my musical endeavors was playing at Glastonbury Festival for several years on the trot.
authors.weekends: Ideally on an outdoor adventure with my young family, or trail running around the muddy hills of Somerset.

authors.name: Ronggur Habibun
authors.bio: Front-end developer who bridges design with functionality. I love building out someone's creative vision into a functional, scalable application that 'just works'.
authors.title: Web Developer
authors.tick: Engineering pixel perfect layouts–it's all in the details.
authors.surprising: I used to have an online shop that sold action figures from Japan.
authors.weekends: Out wandering the city with my wife and son. I love uncovering new corners of my home!

authors.name: Scot Schuchert-Wells
authors.bio: I got my start coding in college and cut my teeth building CI/CD production systems. Since then, I've directed development and delivery of some of the largest edge compute platforms. I thrive in the messy middle between architecture and production deployments.
authors.title: Software Lead
authors.tick: Taking a complicated feature from the whiteboard to production without breaking a sweat.
authors.surprising: I'm a big fan of leg day.
authors.weekends: Meal prepping and getting outdoors.

authors.name: Silvia Olivares
authors.bio: With a background that includes executive coordination and event planning, I'm good at making other people feel good. I thrive on moving ideas forward.
authors.title: Community Lead
authors.tick: Bringing people together. I'm all about the good vibes!
authors.surprising: I love everything paranormal and explore haunted locations all over the world.
authors.weekends: Out in NYC, running a marathon or catching a live show.

authors.name: Steve Smyser
authors.bio: Seasoned Financial Lead and wearer of many hats. From Founder, CFO to Head of Operations, I've led portfolio management for startup acquisitions and cut my teeth in operational governance.
authors.title: CFO
authors.tick: Building sustainable, successful businesses (yes, that means managing budgets too) and learning something new every day.
authors.surprising: I once performed in an opera at the Metropolitan Opera House in NYC where someone fell off the stage into the orchestra pit on opening night!
authors.weekends: Hanging out with family in NYC or practicing piano.

authors.name: Yahya Fakhroji
authors.bio: I cut my chops as a full stack engineer transforming legacy systems into modern, beautiful interfaces for companies like Equinix, FUTR Asia and Packet. A passionate advocate for user centric innovation, I'm always pushing to solve real problems for real people.
authors.title: Engineer
authors.tick: Implementing intuitive designs that just click–good UI should feel invisible.
authors.surprising: I often spend an entire day coding in Starbucks. Coffee and ambient noise keeps me in the zone.
authors.weekends: Gardening or going on food trips with my family.

authors.name: Zac Smith
authors.bio: Veteran cloud builder with 25 years experience. After getting my start in the early days of Linux hosting (Voxel), I built a bare metal automation startup (Packet) and then led digital infrastructure services at Equinix. The humans of the internet are my people!
authors.title: Co-Founder, CEO
authors.tick: Connecting the dots around the next big thing.
authors.surprising: I'm a Juilliard grad who plays double bass in two community orchestras.
authors.weekends: Driving my son's soccer team around or finding NYC's best negroni.

authors.name: Zach Smith
authors.bio: With over a decade of scaled infrastructure experience, I'm at my best when diving super deep into a technical challenge that can make a clear difference for customers. Missed deliverables aren't in my vocabulary.
authors.title: Backend Lead
authors.tick: Eliminating the friction that keeps engineers from doing their best work.
authors.surprising: I'm working at Datum because my name is Zach Smith. Good story!!
authors.weekends: Jamming on my keyboard while watching NFL Sunday.

articles.title: The internet's Own boy
articles.description: Follow the story of Aaron Swartz, the boy who could change the world

articles.title: This shrimp is awesome
articles.description: Mantis shrimps, or stomatopods, are marine crustaceans of the order Stomatopoda.
